required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Estimation of Preoperative Gastric Volume Using Ultrasound
clinical_study.official_title: Ultrasound Assessment of Gastric Volume in Infants Undergoing General Anesthesia: Validation Study

brief_summary.textblock: Aspiration of gastric contents can be a serious anesthetic related complication. Gastric antral sonography prior to anesthesia may have a role in identifying pediatric patients at risk of aspiration. The investigator examined the relationship between sonographic antral area and endoscopically suctioned gastric volumes infants.

primary_outcome.time_frame: immediate after anesthetic induction within 1 minutes.
primary_outcome.description: ultrasound assessment of gastric antral cross sectional area

arm_group.description: Infants patient undergoing general anesthesia for abdominal surgery

intervention.description: gastric volume estimation using gastric ultrasound was performed immediately after anesthetic induction, and after aspirating the residual gastric contents using nasogastric tube

study_pop.textblock: Infants undergoing general anesthesia for abdominal surgery

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Infants undergoing general anesthesia for abdominal surgery
Exclusion Criteria:
- history of recent (within 1 month) surgery on esophagus and stomach
